content: Just testing out webp image files in Backdrop. I've managed to upload one but I don't think image styles resizing can handle them. Perhaps that's an issue with GD?

I suspect it might have something to do with the fact that png+jpg+gif is "hardcoded" somewhere - note: without evidence, just a suspicion. Depending on the php version and how gd was compiled, gd can handle webp.

@Herb Are you testing https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4509 ?

Add webp support · Issue #4509 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need A common "Opportunity" listed in Google PageSpeed insights is to "Serve images in next-gen formats." Backdrop does not currently support any next-gen for...

@indigoxela https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/3136#issuecomment-506351365

[D8] Allow image fields to use any extensions the current image toolkit supports · Issue #3136 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Things to consider: Image uploads need to be allowed Allow it by default? No image styles for SVGs (only attribute mods)? Add support for image styles? (later?) This was addressed in Drupal 8.5.x: ...
The line number might have shifted since then.

@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) I'm aware of that other (and older) Issue, but I'm afraid that supporting everything a toolkit supports is a bit too wide and eventually not possible. And a lot of that older Issue tries to address svg, which gd doesn't support anyway.
I was pointing to that hard coded part you mentioned.

oadaeh (Jason Flatt) said:

I was pointing to that hard coded part you mentioned.

Ah, I see, yes that was one of them. There's a second one in core/modules/system/image.gd.inc But if we extend these two, we get webp support on php 7.1.0 and newer.
I didn't know about that PR. I'll test it at some point

...I vaguely recall reading someplace that there are security implications/concerns with the SVG format (something about being able to inject JS in its code or something like that). But yeah, GD doesn't support svg, so image styles would not be able to be applied to them.

@indigoxela Are you interested in being an advocate for this one? https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4509 If not I will, but I also had my eye on another issue to advocate for. :smile:

No, you just need to make sure people in the meeting know the current status of the issue - either by telling someone directly and asking them to discuss it for you, or just keeping the issue summary up-to-date on a weekly basis.
I also can't attend meetings due to the timezone, but I advocate for issues. I also sometimes update the agenda template directly during the week. Just ask Jen for edit access to Google Drive.

@indigoxela when you get closer to getting the webp issue committed, let's colab on the UX side of it and see if we can make it sing.
